■fn_start
// Share the results of both tool calls with the user
yield <Message>
  The result of the sync tool is **sync6** and the result of the async tool is **async6**.
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Share the results of both tool calls with the user
yield <Message>
  The result of the "sync" tool is **sync6** and the result of the "async" tool is **async6**.
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Greeting John and Sylvain in order as per instructions
MyObject.name = "John"
await MyObject.sayHello({ name: "John" })

MyObject.name = "Sylvain"
await MyObject.sayHello({ name: "Sylvain" })

return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Responding with the results of both tools
yield <Message>
  The result of the sync tool is **sync6**, and the result of the async tool is **async6**.
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Confirming with the user the fetched order ID
yield <Message>
  I have retrieved your order ID: **O666**. Would you like to proceed with deleting this order?
  <Button action="postback" label="Yes, delete it" value="confirm_delete" />
  <Button action="postback" label="No, keep it" value="cancel_delete" />
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Confirming with the user the fetched Order ID before proceeding with deletion
yield <Message type="prompt">
  The order ID fetched is **O666**. Please confirm if you want to delete this order.
  <Button action="postback" label="Yes, delete it" value="confirm_delete" />
  <Button action="postback" label="No, keep it" value="cancel_delete" />
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Informing the user about the error and attempting to confirm the order ID again
yield <Message type="error">
  An error occurred while trying to confirm your order deletion. Let me try again.
</Message>
const message = `The order ID fetched is O666. Do you want to delete this order?`
await confirmWithUser({ message })
return { action: 'think', message }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Informing the user of the results from both tools
yield <Message type="success">
The result of the "sync" tool is **sync6** and the result of the "async" tool is **async6**.
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }

```tsx
■fn_start
// Returning the results of both sync and async tools to the user
yield <Message type="success">
  The result of the "sync" tool is **sync6**, and the result of the "async" tool is **async6**.
</Message>
return { action: 'listen' }
